main.structure

Class DataList

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.structure.DataList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DataList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Object container for all data, contains three array lists containing the headers, data rows, and column attributes. After initializing, use the readFile method to fill with data. To clone, create a new DataList using the DataList(DataList list) constructor.
    Author:
    Zachary Kearney Last Edited: 11/30/2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor for an empty datalist.
      DataList(DataList list)
      Constructor to clone an existing datalist.

      • everyOther

        public java.lang.Object[] everyOther()
        Returns an object array containing two new dataLists. The first datalist is the training set. The second datalist is the test set. The sets are shuffled to select every other value.
        Returns:
        returns Object array containing dataLists.

      • randomShuffle

        public java.lang.Object[] randomShuffle(float percent)
        Returns an object array containing two new dataLists. The first dataList is the training set. The second dataList is the test set. The sets are shuffled randomly, then split by the specified percent.
        Parameters:
        percent - - the percent you wish to be used for training.
        Returns:
        new Object array containing the dataLists.
